title: Just to say it wont install on my Nexus 5 - now it will
comment: Andoid upated to 5 and tried a reinstall and it seems to be working now!

title: Awesome app for Ardour users.
comment: This remote comes very handy while you record yourself on a track.

title: So far , so good !
comment: Works great with my ZTE, Asus U35jc and Ardour 3 on Ubuntu Studio 13.10. Keep it up!

title: Excellent
comment: This app is a fabulous addition to Ardour. It works well. Thank you.

title: Excelent App
comment: Despite this not being changed in a while its an excelent app. F This also works over usb-tethering as i found out. Just find out the ip address of your usb interface using ifconfig. Pop that address into the program and boom up came the track list and i was able to use it as transport control.  Oh dont forget to enable OSC control and feedback in ardour.

title: Awesome app!
comment: very useful, but it have a few features, also Ardour 3 is still a beta. This is a very good starter point.

title: Great start
comment: Seems this project has been abandoned.  But I'd pay for a few more features!  Nice app anyway.

title: much needed & awesome one
comment: just had a trial.. couldnt stop listing out my wishes as features but know it will take time.. any way nice and good work and expecting more...

title: Very convenient
comment: ...but could always have more features.  Has the Dev stopped development?  Ardour 3 is out of beta.... How about more development?  For setting up check David Landry's review a few earlier.

title: Very handy
comment: Now you can record without the need to try and balance a mouse, keyboard, and instrument while trying not to hit the microphone. Move away from your home studio desk, and control the tracking session with your phone or tablet.  I was thinking of buying a small control surface so I wasn't tied to the computer keyboard and mouse while laying down a track, but this does the job almost perfectly.  More features might be nice, but it does the things that really should not have to be done with a mouse and keyboard, so I'm giving it 5 stars.  ------- In Ardour, go into Edit->Preferences and open the 'User Interaction' tab.  In the "Control Surfaces' section, click the 'enable' and 'feedback' check boxes for the OSC section.  Now run the Ardroid app on your Android device, then go to menu->configure  and enter the IP address of the computer running Ardour, then go back to the main screen and click 'Menu->'Connect' and you now have a nice remote control device that will allow you to arm your tracks, play, record, rewind, mute trace, solo tracks, etc.  Much more convenient than trying to control Ardour with a keyboard and mouse while balancing an instrument near a microphone.

title: Awesome
comment: 4 stars for a great start on what I hope will develop into a full-featured Ardour control surface app.    This app is already worthy of purchase.  To be able to stop/rewind/play/record and arm/mute/solo tracks on my phone is a feature that has transformed my ability to use Ardour as the primary DAW in my studio.   Transport works flawlessly on Ardour 2 too, though track information isn't available

title: Pretty Nice
comment: Although it is beta software interacting with beta software over a relatively new communication system, it worked great (once I could turn on OSC in Ardour). Highly recommend.

title: Nice
comment: Well done. But I hope this is just a beginning.  At least a way to undo/delete the last capture, or "Stop and forget capture" would be nice.   amphetamachine: I set the screen timeout to 30 minutes in display settings when I use ardroid. Also created a shortcut to display settings...
Nice and simple. Works great as a remote control. If it would only keep the phone awake I'd give it 5 stars.
